name: Sequence
description:
Little Petya likes to play very much. And most of all he likes to play the
following game: He is given a sequence of N integer numbers. At each step it
is allowed to increase the value of any number by 1 or to decrease it by 1.
The goal of the game is to make the sequence non-decreasing with the smallest
number of steps. Petya is not good at math, so he asks for your help. The
sequence a is called non-decreasing if a1 ≤ a2 ≤ ... ≤ aN holds, where N is
the length of the sequence. Input The first line of the input contains single
integer N (1 ≤ N ≤ 5000) — the length of the initial sequence. The following N
lines contain one integer each — elements of the sequence. These numbers do
not exceed 10^9 by absolute value. Output Output one integer — minimum number
of steps required to achieve the goal. Examples Input 5 3 2 -1 2 11 Output 4
Input 5 2 1 1 1 1 Output 1
